content.description: This route is stellar. Huge jugs, side pulls, pockets, buckets, duckbills...you name it. Super fun sequencing, and a variety of features, including a small sandstone shield with awesome holds. The bottom three bolts are overhanging, pumpy jugs; the crux is on smaller stuff right before the anchors.
content.protection: Wave Bolt glue-ins to anchors with permanent carabiners.
content.location: Starts on the RH flank of the hole/cave on the EFS Wall.

content.description: Buckets and jugs lead to a small crux roof.
content.protection: 4 bolts to chain anchors with permanent carabiners.
content.location:
This is the right most route on the EFS wall. It climbs just left of the shrubs.

For further clarification, this route has bolts with hangers. "Half as Cool as You" is the route to the left and has three FIXE glue-ins bolts to chain anchors. "Spray" is left of "Half as Cool as You" and it's first two bolts are glue-ins, second two are bolts with hangers, and cold shuts at the anchor station.

For 20 years "Spray" was the right most route on this wall. It is now third from the right.

content.description: This is the third climb from the right. Short but pumpy.

content.protection:
4 bolts to 2 bolt anchor

Anchor shared with

Dixon Butz
content.location: Third route on the right in the Box Canyon.

content.description: A route with a lot of variety, fluid movement and fun holds. Pockets, buckets and jugs abound, with some awesome side pulls. A great location!
content.protection: Bolts (wave-bolt glue-ins) to fixed steel carabiners on chains.
content.location: Immediately right of Illustration Arete on the far left-hand side of the EFS wall (if you are looking at the wall). This is the second route right of the couloir that separates the Cobble Roof and the EFS Wall.

content.description:
This is another great route by Noah. Huge jugs lead to a shield of bullet hard stone. Â A couple moves of "I expected that hold to be better" leads to a tiny roof, then to chains under a second roof.

I suspect that at some future date Noah will push this route higher through the roofs above. One thing is for sure, the rock on the EFS wall does not disappoint.
content.protection: 5 glue-in Wave Bolts to anchors with permanent carabiners.
content.location: Locate outside the right flank of a "cave" in the EFS wall and left of the route "Brown Hole". Ascends 4 bolts under a left-leaning arch, then pulls a small roof to a fifth bolt, then anchors with tied carabiners under a second roof.

content.description: Looks easy. Not easy. Chill climbing to 2nd bolt. This brings you to a thinly featured panel of bomber sandstone with no cobbles! 2-3 pretty hard and fingery moves. After the crux, the remaining thin holds to the finish will feel like no big deal.
content.location: Just left of EFS. Locate the obvious cobble free panel of sandstone around bolt 2 and 3.

content.description: Climbs the arete right of the water couloir that separates the Cobble Roof and the EFS wall. Crux is at the last two bolts on a fun vertical section.
content.protection: Bolts, chain anchors. This entire route is equipped with Wave Bolt glue-ins.
content.location: Far left hand side of the EFS wall, first route right of the couloir. The Couloir separates the Cobble Roof and the EFS wall

content.description: Classic pumpy jug-fest with a few fun pockets thrown in for character.
content.protection: 3 glue-in bolts to two-bolt anchor station.
content.location: This is the route second from the right on the EFS wall. It has three PETZL glue-in bolts to chain anchors. Immediately right of "Spray" (.10a).

content.description: Powerful crux down low to a technical slightly inverted face. I liked everything about this route very much except the last 5 feet. Well with doing if you want a break from the same old thing.
An all right route with an unfortunate name. Starts out tough, you grab some cobbles, it gets easier, then its over. What more can you say?
content.protection: Draws for five bolts and an anchor.
content.location:
Second route in on the right. Shares an anchor with

Skeet Shoot

content.description: The second route from the right distinguished by the sandstone dihedral with a crimper rail and no cobbles.  The crux comes at the bottom.
The leftmost route on this wall.  Distinguished by the chain on the 4th (or so) bolt.  Classic route- in your face til the end.
